org.easyrules.quartz

Class RulesEngineScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.easyrules.quartz.RulesEngineScheduler

  • public class RulesEngineScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    Quartz scheduler wrapper used to setup triggers.

    Created by Sunand on 6/8/2015.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RulesEngineScheduler getInstance()
                                        throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Get the scheduler instance.
        Returns:
        The scheduler instance
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException - thrown if an exception occurs while creating the scheduler

      • isScheduled

        public boolean isScheduled(RulesEngine engine)
                    throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Check if the given engine is scheduled.
        Parameters:
        engine - the engine to check
        Returns:
        true if the engine is scheduled, false else
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException - thrown if an exception occurs while checking if the engine is scheduled

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
                  throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Check if the scheduler is started.
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException - thrown if the scheduler status cannot be checked

      • isStopped

        public boolean isStopped()
                  throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Check if the scheduler is stopped.
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException - thrown if the scheduler status cannot be checked

      • scheduleAt

        public void scheduleAt(RulesEngine engine,
              java.util.Date startTime)
                throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Schedule an engine to start at a fixed point of time.
        Parameters:
        engine - the engine to schedule
        startTime - the start time
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException

      • scheduleAtWithInterval

        public void scheduleAtWithInterval(RulesEngine engine,
                          java.util.Date startTime,
                          int interval)
                            throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Schedule an engine to start at a fixed point of time and repeat with interval period.
        Parameters:
        engine - the engine to schedule
        startTime - the start time
        interval - the repeat interval in seconds
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException

      • scheduleCron

        public void scheduleCron(RulesEngine engine,
                java.lang.String cronExpression)
                  throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Schedule an engine with a unix-like cron expression.
        Parameters:
        engine - the engine to schedule
        cronExpression - the cron expression to use. For a complete tutorial about cron expressions, please refer to quartz reference documentation.
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException

      • start

        public void start()
           throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Start the scheduler.
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException - thrown if the scheduler cannot be started

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Stop the scheduler.

        Note: The scheduler cannot be re-started and no more engines can be scheduled.

        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException - thrown if the scheduler cannot be stopped

      • unschedule

        public void unschedule(RulesEngine engine)
                throws RulesEngineSchedulerException
        Unschedule the given engine.
        Parameters:
        engine - the engine to unschedule
        Throws:
        RulesEngineSchedulerException - thrown if an exception occurs during engine unscheduling
